Instructions: Use the buttons in the top right to switch the input.
Algorithm: Store the node in a 2D array.
In the first step, look for the viable pairs as asked. Keep track of the element of the pair with the availability as a future possible starting point.
Sort the found starting points based on the distance to the target (short distance is better). However in our case there is only one possible starting point.
Then, we look to transfer the target data to the (0,0) node. We apply the following algorithm.

• Let's call the active node, the current empty node. At the begining it is our starting node.
  • Our objective is to move this empty node adjacent to the data to transfer while being as close as possible to the final target node (0,0).
  • We call this intermediary node the current target. To reach the current target, we use A* algorithm to move our empty node around.
  • Once arrived at the target, we move the data over to it. Pick the next target, and keep going until we reach the final target point.
Display: For each node, white represents available space, blue the taken space.
The data to transfer is colored green instead of blue.
